topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Accessing Cloud Components

body.p: This page describes how to access the various components in your HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cloud:

section.title: Access the lifecycle manager host
section.p:
To access the lifecycle manager host:
SSH into the lifecycle manager host using the CLM IP of the host. Log in as the root user. The default password is cghelion.ssh root@<CLM_IP> login as: root root@10.x.x.x's password:When you log in, the prompt appears similar to the following:root@system_name:~#

body.section:
Access the lifecycle manager VMTo access the lifecycle manager VM:
SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.
SSH into the lifecycle VM as the root user. The default password is cghelion.ssh root@<CLM_IP> login as: root root@10.x.x.x's password:
The CLM_IP is located on the lifecycle manager VM in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.When you log in, the prompt appears similar to the following:root@cg-hlm:~#

section.title: Access a controller node
section.p:
To access a controller node:
SSH into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.
SSH into the lifecycle VM as the root user. The default password is cghelion.
SSH into a controller using the CLM IP of the controller. Log in as the cghelion user. No password is required.ssh cghelion@<CLM_IP>
The CLM IP is located on the lifecycle manager VM in the /var/hlm/clouds/lr4tb2c1b41/desired_state/lr4tb2c1b41/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file. Look in the [BASE-CCP-T1] section:BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.102 BASE-CCP-T1-M2-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.103 BASE-CCP-T1-M3-NETCLM ansible_ssh_host=10.20.37.104 When you log in, the prompt appears similar to the following, depending upon the system you are using:cghelion@BASE-CCP-T1-M1-NETCLM:~$

body.section:
Access the Horizon Dashboard
At this point, you can log into the Horizon interface, a web-interface you can use to manage and maintain HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. Use the CAN IP address to launch Horizon. You can locate the CAN IP address in the ~/stackrc file on any of the controller nodes in the Standard Region. The CAN IP address contains port 5000. For example: export OS_PASSWORD=qekuTPcc26Ig export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.20.4.120:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=tahoe unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME unset OS_PROJECT_NAME unset OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION unset OS_AUTH_VERSION
In this case, the CAN IP address is located in the OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.x.x.x:5000/v2.0 line. You would log in using https://10.x.x.x.
Enter the IP in the browser to access the log-in page:https://<CAN_IP>
By default, the user name is admin. You can find the installation password for admin in the /root/stackrc file from any of the controller nodes. export OS_PASSWORD=qekuTPcc26 export OS_USERNAME=admin

section.title: Access the HCG Dashboard UI
section.p: The HCG Dashboard UI can be accessed using any supported web browser using the IP address of the lifecycle manager VM and port 8080. http://<HLM_IP>:8080

section.title: Access the iLO console
section.p: iLO is HPE Integrated Lights-Out, a server management tool embedded with the ProLiant servers.

The iLO interface can be accessed using any supported web browser using the iLO IP address and port 80. Consult your iLO documentation for information on how to locate the iLO IP address, user name, and password. https://<iLO_IP>:80
